question: Question_Section_102_07_(b)
statement:
Decide whether or not the following statement is true or false. If true,
give a proof. If false, give a counterexample.

\textbf{(b)} If \emph{AB = I}, then \emph{BA = I}. (Warning: do
\emph{not} assume that \emph{A} and \emph{B} are square matrices.)
sols:
FALSE

Counterexample:

A = $\begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 &0 \\
0& 1 &0
\end{bmatrix}$

B = $\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0\\
0& 1\\
1 & 1
\end{bmatrix}$

Then

AB = $\begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 &0 \\
0& 1 &0
\end{bmatrix}$$\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0\\
0& 1\\
1 & 1
\end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 \\
0&1
\end{bmatrix}$ = $I$

BUT

BA = $\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0\\
0& 1\\
1 & 1
\end{bmatrix}$$\begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 &0 \\
0& 1 &0
\end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix}
1& 0 &0 \\
0& 1 & 0\\
1& 1 &0
\end{bmatrix}$ $\neq I$

$\therefore$ If $AB = I,$then $BA = I$ is not always true.
hints:
The warning in the problem is a hint. Try considering non-square
matrices.
